title: Chocolate Pomegranate Tart
directions: Crust: In a medium bowl combine the melted butter, sugar, and kosher salt. Mix it well until combined.
Add in the flour, almond flour, and cocoa powder. Mix it again until the dough forms into a nice ball.
Line a rectangular tart pan with parchment paper and press the dough into an even layer, making sure it gets into every corner. Then let it chill for 30 minutes in the refrigerator.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
After the dough has rested, prick it with a fork several times. Then bake for 20-22 minutes until golden brown. Pull it out and let it cool completely
Ganache Filling: Add the heavy cream, vanilla extract , and salt into a medium saucepan. Cook it on medium heat just until it starts to boil, and then remove from heat right away.
Stir in the semi-sweet chocolate and butter and stir it just until it combines into a glossy mixture. Then add 1/4 cup of the Pomegranate Arils.
Fill the crust with the chocolate filling all the way up to the top. Take another 1/4 cup of the pomegranate seeds and sprinkle it over the top.
Let it sit a room temperature for 2 hours. Then slice into wedges and serve.
